column3:
> lack of use

But didn't @luke-jr use it in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6971#issuecomment-156788484?

> serving as a reference

Is there a "new and better" way to test multiple bins?

@MarcoFalke The framework for testing multiple binaries is still in place.  The methods I used in this pull (especially using invalidateblock/reconsiderblock over and over) should probably be done a better way somehow, but I haven't thought about how I'd do it again if I were going to reimplement.\n\nAs for the meat of this test, it is just implementing the script tests that are performed by the u
The breakage in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6971#issuecomment-156788484 is related to the test framework more than script_test.py AFAICT...\n

Removing unmaintained and dead code is good practice. Anyone that wants to 'resurrect' the code can always get it from git history.

Speaking of which - I'd really like to re-enable the rpcbind.py test without the IPv6 part until the a new stable libevent is in common use. With libevent's release schedule it may take years otherwise :-)
